result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alontea K Crittenden

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.

8:44 AM Defendant Alontea K Crittenden in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Alontea K Crittenden.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense requests a new date to allow time to speak again with the State. State does not object. Court sets.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alontea K Crittenden in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Alontea K Crittenden. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. There are no victims.

Defense is asking for a plea/sentencing date in early October for the Defendant to obtain his Driver's License.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Alontea K Crittenden in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze by Attorney Carlson.

Defense is still waiting on an offer from the State.
  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
Repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing July 1, 2022. (BC)

10:05 AM Defendant Alontea K Crittenden in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing July 1, 2022.  
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP A WAGE ASSIGNMENT.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

notarized and filed by defendant.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 6/1/2022 - To be addressed by Commissioner Herring at the initial appearance.**
